definitions.definition: The act of avowing and justifying in one's own right the distraining of goods .
A form of medieval patronage in which colonial tenants , often from criminal backgrounds, were guaranteed protection by an English lord in exchange for the payment of a tax .
Advowson , the right to appoint to a benefice or office .
A protector , especially a patron saint .

main_definition: ( law ) The act of avowing and justifying in one's own right the distraining of goods .
secondary_definitions: ( historical ) A form of medieval patronage in which colonial tenants , often from criminal backgrounds, were guaranteed protection by an English lord in exchange for the payment of a tax .
( ecclesiastical ) Advowson , the right to appoint to a benefice or office .
( obsolete ) A protector , especially a patron saint .
